data.title: A Chorus Line: Original Cast & Creative Team
data.text:
A Chorus Line

The Original Broadway Cast & Creative Team

Compiled by John Kenrick and William McKay

Tens of thousands saw A Chorus Line by using discount coupons like this one. Allowing people to purchase tickets at the box office at half price, these "two-fers" were distributed at schools, visitors centers, hotels and restaurants through the 1980's. Click on the image to see a magnified image.

(This information is taken from the Original Cast Playbill for A Chorus Line as The Shubert Theatre, New York.)

(in alphabetical order)

Renee Baughman . . . .Kristine

Cameron Mason . . . . Mark

Donna McKechnie . . . . Cassie

Sammy Williams . . . . Paul

Crissy Wilzak . . . . Vicki

An Audition

Time: Now

Place: Here

The characters portrayed in "A Chorus Line" are, for the most part, based upon the lives and experiences of Broadway dancers. This show is dedicated to anyone who has ever danced in a chorus or marched in step . . . anywhere.

A CHORUS LINE IS PERFORMED WITHOUT AN INTERMISSION

Understudies:

Al, Mike - John Mineo

Paul, Richie - Chuck Cissel

Kristine, Connie, Maggie - Donna Drake

Don, Mark - Brandt Edwards

Cassie, Sheila - Carolyn Kirsch

Diana, Bebe - Carole Schweid

Larry, Greg, Bobby - Michael Serrecchia

Val, Judy - Crissy Wilzak

Zach - Clive Clerk

The Creative Team

A New York Shakespeare Festival Production

in association with PLUM Productions

Joseph Papp presents A CHORUS LINE

Conceived, Choreographed and Directed by Michael Bennett

Book by James Kirkwood and Nicholas Dante

Music by Marvin Hamlisch

Lyrics by Edward Kleban

Co-choreographer: Bob Avian

Settings by Robin Wagner

Costumes by Theoni V. Aldredge

Lighting by Tharon Musser

Sound by Abe Jacob

Orchestrations by Bill Byers, Hershy Kay & Jonathan Tunick

Music Coordinator: Robert Thomas

Music Directions and Vocal Arrangements by Don Pippin

Associate Producer: Bernard Gersten

Assistant to the Choreographers & Dance Captain: Baayork Lee

General Manager: Robert Kamlot

General Press Representative: Merle Debusky

Production Stage Manager: Jeff Hamlin

Stage Manager: Frank Hartenstein

Company Manager: Patricia Carney

Press Representative: Bob Ullman

Associate Conductor: Jerry Goldberg

The Original Cast Recording

Columbia Records

Producer: Goddard Lieberson

Associate Producers: Teo Macero & Larry Morton

Engineers: Frank Laico, John Guerriere

Recorded June 2, 1975 at Columbia's 30th Street Studios, Manhattan.

Released October 1975
